Title: Spring Training Smoothie
Author: Micheal Glab
Ingredients: 1 cup of 2% milk fat Greek yogurt
Directions: Add fruit spinach and yogurt to blender.
Pour in water. Ok to add more than 1/2 cup for desired consistency.
Blend for 30-60 seconds until uniform mixture or desired consistency is achieved.

Title: Carrot Cake Overnight Oats
Author: Lidia Panozzo
Ingredients: 1/4 cup milk of choice (dairy almond or coconut)
1 Tbsp ground flax or chia seeds
Directions: Mix all ingredient s (oats through salt) in a mason jar or other closed container
Cover tightly with lid and refrigerate overnight or 6 hours minimum
When ready to serve top with walnuts, coconut flakes, and a drizzle of maple syrup.

Title: Lemon-Berry Overnight Oats
Author: Allison Koch
Ingredients: 1/2 cup fresh or frozen mixed berries (frozen berries will thaw in the fridge overnight)
Directions: Mix together oats yogurt milk chia seeds lemon juice and zest in a bowl then pour into glass or jar ( suggested vessel: mason jar).
Cover and place in the fridge overnight. In the morning remove from fridge mix and add additional milk if desired.
Top with additional berries and almonds and serve.

Title: Grilled Zucchini with Goat Cheese and Pine Nuts
Author: Chelsea Stegman
Ingredients: 1/2 tsp. sea salt and black pepper
Juice of 1/2 a lemon plus lemon zest
Directions: Prepare the grill on medium heat. Slice the zucchini into thin strips lengthwise. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper on both sides. Set aside.
Heat a small skillet over medium low heat on the stove. When hot add the pine nuts and toast them toss constantly until lightly browned about 3 -4 minutes.
Grill the zucchini for 2-3 minutes on each side. Arrange on platter and drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Top with goat cheese pine nuts and herbs.

Title: Broccoli and Mushroom Stir Fry
Author: Alicia Huggler
Ingredients: 2 cups broccoli cut into small florets
Directions: In a large skillet on high heat add the broccoli onion garlic mushrooms red pepper ginger and water. Cook stirring of ten until broccoli is soft and onions are translucent. Add broth and more as needed to prevent the vegetables from sticking.
Stir in the carrot cashews vinegar soy sauce and coconut sugar. Stir well and simmer for about 2 minutes . Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve alone or on top of quinoa or brown rice.

Title: Citrus Fennel Salad
Author: Amy Silver
Ingredients: 1 small fennel bulb very thinly sliced
1/2 shallot peeled and very thinly sliced
kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper
Directions: Slice the peels off of the citrus and place in a bowl or on a serving plate. Layer with thinly slivered fennel slices . Add avocado slices carrot ribbons and shallot slivers.
In a small bowl slowly whisk the olive oil into the champagne vinegar until emulsified. Add the honey and whisk to mix . Season with kosher salt and pepper.
Pour dressing over the salad and season with more kosher salt and freshly ground pepper. Top with reserved fennel fronds and mint leaves.
